original_theorem:
If a sequence $\{u_n\}$ in a metric space $(A,\rho)$ is convergent$,$
then it is a Cauchy sequence.
theorem_translation:
```lean4
theorem convergent_seq_is_cauchy {A : Type*} [MetricSpace A] {u : â„• â†’ A}
    (h_convergent : âˆƒ l, Tendsto u atTop (ð“ l)) : CauchySeq u := by
```

import Mathlib
import Aesop

set_option maxHeartbeats 0
open BigOperators Real Nat Topology Rat Filter
theorem convergent_seq_is_cauchy {A : Type*} [MetricSpace A] {u : â„• â†’ A}
    (h_convergent : âˆƒ l, Tendsto u atTop (ð“ l)) : CauchySeq u := by sorry

proof_steps.natural_language:
We assume:
â€¢ The sequence $\{u_n\}$ converges to a limit $u$ in the metric space $(A, \rho)$ [def_1].
Therefore, we conclude:
â€¢ By the definition of a limit, for any $\epsilon > 0$, there exists an integer $N$ such that for any integer $k > N$, we have $\rho(u_k, u) < \epsilon/2$ [l1].
proof_steps.lean_tactics:
rcases h_convergent with âŸ¨l, hlâŸ©
  have h_l1 : âˆ€ Îµ > 0, âˆƒ N, âˆ€ n â‰¥ N, dist (u n) l < Îµ / 2 :=
    fun Îµ hÎµ â†¦ (Metric.tendsto_atTop.mp hl) (Îµ / 2) (half_pos hÎµ)

attempt_history.verified_code:
import Mathlib
import Aesop

set_option maxHeartbeats 0
open BigOperators Real Nat Topology Rat Filter
theorem convergent_seq_is_cauchy {A : Type*} [MetricSpace A] {u : â„• â†’ A}
    (h_convergent : âˆƒ l, Tendsto u atTop (ð“ l)) : CauchySeq u := by
  rcases h_convergent with âŸ¨l, hlâŸ©
  have h_l1 : âˆ€ Îµ > 0, âˆƒ N, âˆ€ n â‰¥ N, dist (u n) l < Îµ / 2 :=
    fun Îµ hÎµ â†¦ (Metric.tendsto_atTop.mp hl) (Îµ / 2) (half_pos hÎµ)
  sorry

proof_steps.natural_language:
We assume:
â€¢ $\{u_n\}_{n \in \mathbb{N}}$ is a sequence of points and $u$ is a point in a metric space $(A, \rho)$ [def_1].
Therefore, we conclude:
â€¢ For any $n, m \in \mathbb{N}$, the triangle inequality holds: $\rho(u_n, u_m) \le \rho(u_n, u) + \rho(u, u_m)$ [l2].
proof_steps.lean_tactics:
have l2 : âˆ€ n m, dist (u n) (u m) â‰¤ dist (u n) l + dist l (u m) :=
    fun n m â†¦ dist_triangle (u n) l (u m)

attempt_history.verified_code:
import Mathlib
import Aesop

set_option maxHeartbeats 0
open BigOperators Real Nat Topology Rat Filter
theorem convergent_seq_is_cauchy {A : Type*} [MetricSpace A] {u : â„• â†’ A}
    (h_convergent : âˆƒ l, Tendsto u atTop (ð“ l)) : CauchySeq u := by
  rcases h_convergent with âŸ¨l, hlâŸ©
  have h_l1 : âˆ€ Îµ > 0, âˆƒ N, âˆ€ n â‰¥ N, dist (u n) l < Îµ / 2 :=
    fun Îµ hÎµ â†¦ (Metric.tendsto_atTop.mp hl) (Îµ / 2) (half_pos hÎµ)
  have l2 : âˆ€ n m, dist (u n) (u m) â‰¤ dist (u n) l + dist l (u m) :=
    fun n m â†¦ dist_triangle (u n) l (u m)
  sorry

proof_steps.natural_language:
We assume:
â€¢ $\{u_n\}$ is a sequence in a metric space $(A, \rho)$ with limit $u \in A$ [def_1].
â€¢ For any $\epsilon > 0$, there exists an integer $N$ such that for any integer $k > N$, we have $\rho(u_k, u) < \epsilon/2$ [l1].
â€¢ For any $n, m \in \mathbb{N}$, $\rho(u_n, u_m) \le \rho(u_n, u) + \rho(u, u_m)$ [l2].
Therefore, we conclude:
â€¢ The sequence $\{u_n\}$ is a Cauchy sequence. That is, for any $\epsilon > 0$, there exists an integer $N$ such that for all $m, n > N$, we have $\rho(u_n, u_m) < \epsilon$ [ts_1].
proof_steps.lean_tactics:
rw [Metric.cauchySeq_iff]
intro Îµ hÎµ
rcases h_l1 Îµ hÎµ with âŸ¨N, hNâŸ©
use N
intros m n hm hn
calc
  dist (u m) (u n) â‰¤ dist (u m) l + dist l (u n) := dist_triangle (u m) l (u n)
  _ = dist (u m) l + dist (u n) l := by rw [dist_comm l (u n)]
  _ < Îµ / 2 + Îµ / 2 := add_lt_add (hN m hm) (hN n hn)
  _ = Îµ := by simp [add_halves]

import Mathlib
import Aesop

set_option maxHeartbeats 0
open BigOperators Real Nat Topology Rat Filter
theorem convergent_seq_is_cauchy {A : Type*} [MetricSpace A] {u : â„• â†’ A}
    (h_convergent : âˆƒ l, Tendsto u atTop (ð“ l)) : CauchySeq u := by
  rcases h_convergent with âŸ¨l, hlâŸ©
  have h_l1 : âˆ€ Îµ > 0, âˆƒ N, âˆ€ n â‰¥ N, dist (u n) l < Îµ / 2 :=
    fun Îµ hÎµ â†¦ (Metric.tendsto_atTop.mp hl) (Îµ / 2) (half_pos hÎµ)
  have l2 : âˆ€ n m, dist (u n) (u m) â‰¤ dist (u n) l + dist l (u m) :=
